text: my name is olan Rogers I'm the creator
and executive producer of final space I
got my start off on the internet making
short films stories comedy I made a
proof of concept we're making the show
the full show 14 yes it's got action
it's got drama it's got comedy
it's got sci-fi you want this thing
because I want it and guess what this is
the behind the scenes of that this is
something that I've been working towards
my whole career when we're starting with
final space we create a design packet a
step-by-step process of how to design on
final space then we do a record with the
actors coming in and doing the
voice-over records once that is final we
send that into what's called animatic
where they cut to storyboard panels to
the radio play there's definitely a lot
of a lot of back-and-forth between you
know what Olin wants and what I'm trying
to communicate like the joy we tried to
treat this more like a feature film Olin
definitely wanted to take final space
into a more cinematic realm one of the
things that we tried to get all the
directors on board with was making sure
that every shot had foreground middle
ground background adds a little rim
light and atmosphere but misty in the
air and there's fire and smoke so we
wanted to make sure that every shot felt
like you could tell what lens we were
using
David and all that we're looking for
some concept art for this thing that
doesn't exist in any dimension so I
channeled the most MC escher part of me
and made the Lazarus trap only master
trap makers can make these and people
who really like stairs I was both 100%
on board and 100% terrified of doing
that art so the star fields are probably
one of our most beautiful assets in
final space we're actually using space
to build in a final space we took images
from the Hubble telescope from different
nebulas kind of blend in this really
nice atmosphere to build for that world
we were able to design the spaceship in
3d and blend it into the 2d world David
Nolan said they wanted the prime time
animated cartoon meets Christopher Nolan
you know one of my first tasks after
being on the team was to help decide
which animation studio we were going to
we landed at shout machine it's got
creative challenges and so we needed a
studio to help us get there jam field is
our animation studio in Ottawa a lot of
the time when we sit there and we get
these shots back we're like uh you know
the framing is cool and the animation is
nice but it's not quite what we felt and
jam-filled nine times ten times out of
ten would have these amazing
performances and that's sort of the best
thing you could look for and I got to
say working with olan Rogers has been
one of the best things that has happened
to me in my career just seeing olan as a
first-time creator you know kind of grow
through this whole process is really
incredible it's this guy by himself on
YouTube and is he back there now it's
like a hundred and fifty people working
on this thing you see this person now
coming out of this shell inspiring this
team I feel like he has the confidence
in me to do what I do best I've never
been given simultaneously so much
support and so much freedom to be an
artist it's very rewarding to be working
with such a great team and then in this
show specifically which is different
than other shows that I've worked on our
compositing process at the end which is
what Mike and Ben are really involved in
developed the show and gave it this
really cinematic quality then they just
put the cherry on top and the show just
looks so phenomenal final space all new
episodes Mondays at 10:30 on TBS
